net.jawr.web.servlet
Interface IllegalBundleRequestHandler

All Known Implementing Classes:
IllegalBundleRequestHandlerImpl
public interface IllegalBundleRequestHandler

This interface defines the methods of the Handler for illegal requested bundles, the bundle which are requested with a wrong hashcode.

Author:
Ibrahim Chaehoi

Method Summary
 boolean canWriteContent(java.lang.String requestedPath, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
          This method should return true if Jawr should send back the content of the bundle.
 boolean writeResponseHeader(java.lang.String requestedPath, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
          This method can update the response header and returns true if the header has been written and false if Jawr must write the response header.
 

Method Detail

writeResponseHeader

boolean writeResponseHeader(java.lang.String requestedPath,
                            javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                            javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
                            throws java.io.IOException
This method can update the response header and returns true if the header has been written and false if Jawr must write the response header.

Parameters:
requestedPath - the requested path
request - the request
response - the response
Returns:
true if the header has been written and false if Jawr must write the response header.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if an IOException occurs
